column2: PW 10  who is a retired Additional Director of the Provincial Education

column1: Office at  pages 230 and 231 of the brief has stated that contributions are  made
to the School Development Fund maintained by the School. Thus, it appears it
was an accepted fact and nothing illegal was imputed to collecting funds in to that
account.
T
column2: he Counsel for the Appellant  among the other grounds of appeal argued

column1: and,  vehemently    contended  that  the  prosecution  has  failed  to  prove  the  case
beyond reasonable doubt. He submitted that the date, place or time of solicitation
has not been proved and that the   learned trial judge has failed to consider these
important  points.  Further,  that  the  learned  trial  Judge  has  misdirected  himself
when  he  has  concluded  that  apart  from
column2: Rs  25000/-  which  was  to  be  the

column1: contribution to the School Development Fund another Rs 25000/- was solicited
when  there  was  no  evidence  to  that  effect  .  At  page  272  of  the  brief  in  the
judgment it states as follows;

column2: The  learned  judge  who  delivered  judgment  has  not  had  the  benefit  of

column1: observing the evidence of the main witness PW 1 who alleges that the appellant
